ud3.3:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ud3.3:1.3: Now at that time around five hundred mendicants headed by Yasoja arrived at Sāvatthī to see the Buddha.
ud3.3:1.4: Those visiting mendicants, while exchanging pleasantries with the resident mendicants, preparing their lodgings, and putting away their bowls and robes, made a dreadful racket.
ud3.3:2.1: Then the Buddha said to Venerable Ānanda,
ud3.3:2.2: “Ānanda, who’s making that dreadful racket? You’d think it was fishermen hauling in a catch!”
ud3.3:2.3: “Sir, these five hundred mendicants headed by Yasoja have arrived at Sāvatthī to see the Buddha.
ud3.3:2.4: It’s those visiting mendicants who, while exchanging pleasantries with the resident mendicants, preparing their lodgings, and putting away their bowls and robes, made a dreadful racket.”
